title: The Works of Robert Louis Stevenson - Swanston Edition, Vol. 16
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: Having been enabled to-day to get the dimensions of the foundation, orfirst stone, accurately taken, a mould was made of its figure, when thewriter left the rock, after the tide's work of this morning, in a fastrowing-boat for Arbroath; and, upon landing, two men were immediatelyset to work upon one of the blocks from Mylnefield quarry, which wasprepared in the course of the following day, as the stone-cuttersrelieved each other, and worked both night and day, so that it was sentoff in one of the stone-lighters without delay.
